angle.headline: The Tasman Trap: Surviving Phase II/III Closures
angle.angle: The City just dropped the hammer: Tasman Drive is locked down from Jan 28 to Feb 13 (Phase II & III). If you usually drive down Tasman to get to the Green Lot, you're driving into a wall. We're mapping the survival routes for locals and visitors alike.
angle.topic: Super Bowl LX Phase II/III Road Closures & Tasman Drive Lockdown

specific_facts: Tasman Drive is fully closed to private vehicles between Convention Center and Great America Parkway (Jan 28 - Feb 13).
VTA Light Rail is the *only* motorized vehicle allowed to cross the 'Hard Zone' perimeter.
Official rideshare drop-off has been moved to Red Lot 7, which is a 25-minute walk.
Mercado Shopping Center on Mission College Blvd allows for 'unofficial' drop-offs with a direct path to the Creek Trail.
Phase III security barriers (concrete K-rails) were installed last night.
sources_to_cite: City of Santa Clara Traffic Advisory (Jan 28 Update)
key_quotes_stats: "Tasman isn't a road anymore; it's a fortress."
"The walk from Mercado takes 18 minutes. The wait in the official rideshare queue is currently averaging 45 minutes."
"Drivers are cancelling rides if they see a destination pin inside the 'Soft Zone' because they know they'll get trapped."
counter_arguments_to_address: "I'll just take the official Fan Express Shuttle." (Rebuttal: Shuttles are stuck in the same gridlock on Great America Pkwy; walking the trail is time-invariant).
"My GPS says Tasman is open." (Rebuttal: GPS apps haven't updated for the Phase III hard closure yet; trust the physical barriers).
related_topics_for_context: San Tomas Aquino Creek Trail access points
